channel.title: Kotlin on Reece's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Kotlin on Reece's Blog

item.title: Notes on Kotlin for sololearn course
item.description:
Learning Kotlin through sololearn 2021-02-25 Thu 09:19 AM Printing like in java (println("")) println(“strings”+variable_casted_to_string) println(variable) println(variable+" “+variable1) println(“numbers in from top to bottom 
 1 
 2 
 3”) 
 	 for newline and tab Main function fun main(Args Array:<String>){ // body statements } 2021-02-26 Fri 11:10 you do not need to have args in the bracket of main, if you are not passing anything into it. 2021-02-26 Fri 11:11 In order for the kotlin interpretor (kotlin) to run on a file it needs to have the .
